snippet.title: Hunting the Dark Knight: Twenty-First Century Batman
snippet.description: An investigation into the Batman movie franchise by Christopher Nolan analyzes the relationship between popular films, audiences, and producers, addressing questions about timelines and the "Why So Serious" marketing campaign.

snippet.title: The Batman Filmography, 2d ed.
snippet.description: We have one more bit of business to attend to relating to The Dark Knight Rises before we finish up our discussion of the film. ... There were two different DVD versions of the film—it was offered both as a single-disc release and as a 2-disc set.

snippet.title: The Art and Making of The Dark Knight Trilogy
snippet.description: A lushly illustrated account of the making of the Dark Knight Trilogy includes previously unseen photography and draws on interviews with director Christopher Nolan as well as key cast and crew members to offer insight into the creative ...

snippet.title: The Dark Knight Trilogy: The Complete Screenplays
snippet.description: (Book). At nearly six hundred pages, The Dark Knight Trilogy , a behemoth of script and storyboards, captures on the page the dark mythic expanse of the cinematic Batman.

snippet.title: The Dark Knight Manual: Tools, Weapons, Vehicles & ...
snippet.description: Explores the world created by filmmaker Christopher Nolan and his reboot of the Batman series in 2005 with "Batman Begins" and continuing through to "The Dark Knight" and the upcoming series conclusion "The Dark Knight Rises."
